<Link id="l00015" /><CodeLine lineNumber="15"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// series of operations for all inputs.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00020" /><CodeLine lineNumber="20"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// %3 = icmp slt icmp %1, %2</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00021" /><CodeLine lineNumber="21"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// \\endcode</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00023" /><CodeLine lineNumber="23"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// and</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00024" /><CodeLine lineNumber="24"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00025" /><CodeLine lineNumber="25"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// \\code</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00026" /><CodeLine lineNumber="26"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// %1 = add i32 11, %a</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00027" /><CodeLine lineNumber="27"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// %2 = sub i32 %a, %1</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00028" /><CodeLine lineNumber="28"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// %3 = icmp sgt icmp %2, %1</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00029" /><CodeLine lineNumber="29"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// \\endcode</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00030" /><CodeLine lineNumber="30"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00031" /><CodeLine lineNumber="31"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// ultimately have the same result, even if the inputs, and structure are</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00032" /><CodeLine lineNumber="32"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// slightly different.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00033" /><CodeLine lineNumber="33"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00034" /><CodeLine lineNumber="34"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// For instructions, we do not worry about operands that do not have fixed</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00035" /><CodeLine lineNumber="35"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// semantic meaning to the program.  We consider the opcode that the instruction</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00036" /><CodeLine lineNumber="36"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// has, the types, parameters, and extra information such as the function name,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00037" /><CodeLine lineNumber="37"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// or comparison predicate.  These are used to create a hash to map instructions</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00038" /><CodeLine lineNumber="38"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// to integers to be used in similarity matching in sequences of instructions</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00039" /><CodeLine lineNumber="39"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00040" /><CodeLine lineNumber="40"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Terminology:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00041" /><CodeLine lineNumber="41"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// An IRSimilarityCandidate is a region of IRInstructionData (wrapped</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00042" /><CodeLine lineNumber="42"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Instructions), usually used to denote a region of similarity has been found.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00064" /><CodeLine lineNumber="64"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00065" /><CodeLine lineNumber="65"><Highlight kind="comment">/// This represents what is and is not supported when finding similarity in</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00066" /><CodeLine lineNumber="66"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Instructions.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00067" /><CodeLine lineNumber="67"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00068" /><CodeLine lineNumber="68"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Legal Instructions are considered when looking at similarity between</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00069" /><CodeLine lineNumber="69"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Instructions.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00070" /><CodeLine lineNumber="70"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00071" /><CodeLine lineNumber="71"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Illegal Instructions cannot be considered when looking for similarity</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00072" /><CodeLine lineNumber="72"><Highlight kind="comment">/// between Instructions. They act as boundaries between similarity regions.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00073" /><CodeLine lineNumber="73"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00074" /><CodeLine lineNumber="74"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Invisible Instructions are skipped over during analysis.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00075" /><CodeLine lineNumber="75"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// TODO: Shared with MachineOutliner</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00076" /><CodeLine lineNumber="76" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/irsimilarity/#af46430106334db52bfa7a4107e53a0bda16a84ba67d52e1c64fb48ce437b569ab"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">enum</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/irsimilarity/#af46430106334db52bfa7a4107e53a0bd">InstrType</a> &#123; <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/irsimilarity/#af46430106334db52bfa7a4107e53a0bda8f7357506e00d8cd0694f948f909865d">Legal</a>, <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/irsimilarity/#af46430106334db52bfa7a4107e53a0bda16a84ba67d52e1c64fb48ce437b569ab">Illegal</a>, <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/irsimilarity/#af46430106334db52bfa7a4107e53a0bda47b7bba75c0c242b40fece427c2bfefa">Invisible</a> &#125;;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00077" /><CodeLine lineNumber="77"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00078" /><CodeLine lineNumber="78"><Highlight kind="comment">/// This provides the utilities for hashing an Instruction to an unsigned</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00079" /><CodeLine lineNumber="79"><Highlight kind="comment">/// integer. Two IRInstructionDatas produce the same hash value when their</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00080" /><CodeLine lineNumber="80"><Highlight kind="comment">/// underlying Instructions perform the same operation (even if they don&#39;t have</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00081" /><CodeLine lineNumber="81"><Highlight kind="comment">/// the same input operands.)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00082" /><CodeLine lineNumber="82"><Highlight kind="comment">/// As a more concrete example, consider the following:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00083" /><CodeLine lineNumber="83"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00084" /><CodeLine lineNumber="84"><Highlight kind="comment">/// \\code</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00085" /><CodeLine lineNumber="85"><Highlight kind="comment">/// %add1 = add i32 %a, %b</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00086" /><CodeLine lineNumber="86"><Highlight kind="comment">/// %add2 = add i32 %c, %d</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00087" /><CodeLine lineNumber="87"><Highlight kind="comment">/// %add3 = add i64 %e, %f</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00088" /><CodeLine lineNumber="88"><Highlight kind="comment">/// \\endcode</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00089" /><CodeLine lineNumber="89"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00090" /><CodeLine lineNumber="90"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Then the IRInstructionData wrappers for these Instructions may be hashed like</Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00091" /><CodeLine lineNumber="91"><Highlight kind="comment">/// so:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00092" /><CodeLine lineNumber="92"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00093" /><CodeLine lineNumber="93"><Highlight kind="comment">/// \\code</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00094" /><CodeLine lineNumber="94"><Highlight kind="comment">/// ; These two adds have the same types and operand types, so they hash to the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00095" /><CodeLine lineNumber="95"><Highlight kind="comment">/// ; same number.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00096" /><CodeLine lineNumber="96"><Highlight kind="comment">/// %add1 = add i32 %a, %b ; Hash: 1</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00097" /><CodeLine lineNumber="97"><Highlight kind="comment">/// %add2 = add i32 %c, %d ; Hash: 1</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00098" /><CodeLine lineNumber="98"><Highlight kind="comment">/// ; This add produces an i64. This differentiates it from %add1 and %add2. So,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00099" /><CodeLine lineNumber="99"><Highlight kind="comment">/// ; it hashes to a different number.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00100" /><CodeLine lineNumber="100"><Highlight kind="comment">/// %add3 = add i64 %e, %f; Hash: 2</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00101" /><CodeLine lineNumber="101"><Highlight kind="comment">/// \\endcode</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00102" /><CodeLine lineNumber="102"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00103" /><CodeLine lineNumber="103"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00104" /><CodeLine lineNumber="104"><Highlight kind="comment">/// This hashing scheme will be used to represent the program as a very long</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00105" /><CodeLine lineNumber="105"><Highlight kind="comment">/// string. This string can then be placed in a data structure which can be used</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00106" /><CodeLine lineNumber="106"><Highlight kind="comment">/// for similarity queries.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00107" /><CodeLine lineNumber="107"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00108" /><CodeLine lineNumber="108"><Highlight kind="comment">/// TODO: Handle types of Instructions which can be equal even with different</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00109" /><CodeLine lineNumber="109"><Highlight kind="comment">/// operands. (E.g. comparisons with swapped predicates.)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00110" /><CodeLine lineNumber="110"><Highlight kind="comment">/// TODO: Handle CallInsts, which are only checked for function type</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00111" /><CodeLine lineNumber="111"><Highlight kind="comment">/// by \\ref isSameOperationAs.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00112" /><CodeLine lineNumber="112"><Highlight kind="comment">/// TODO: Handle GetElementPtrInsts, as some of the operands have to be the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00113" /><CodeLine lineNumber="113"><Highlight kind="comment">/// exact same, and some do not.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00114" /><CodeLine lineNumber="114" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/irsimilarity/irinstructiondata"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">struct </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/irsimilarity/irinstructiondata/#a31d26022f657b77aa802a9190611e87b">IRInstructionData</a></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00115" /><CodeLine lineNumber="115"><Highlight kind="normal">    : <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/ilist-node">ilist&#95;node</a>&lt;IRInstructionData, ilist&#95;sentinel&#95;tracking&lt;true&gt;&gt; &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00117" /><CodeLine lineNumber="117"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// The source Instruction that is being wrapped.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00118" /><CodeLine lineNumber="118" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/irsimilarity/irinstructiondata/#a8f280453f9963266308cb61e428f5268"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction">Instruction</a> &#42;<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/irsimilarity/irinstructiondata/#a8f280453f9963266308cb61e428f5268">Inst</a> = </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">nullptr</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00119" /><CodeLine lineNumber="119"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// The values of the operands in the Instruction.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00120" /><CodeLine lineNumber="120" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/irsimilarity/irinstructiondata/#ab39a288c69393c860063b5d0348dc05a"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvector">SmallVector&lt;Value &#42;, 4&gt;</a> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/irsimilarity/irinstructiondata/#ab39a288c69393c860063b5d0348dc05a">OperVals</a>;</Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00121" /><CodeLine lineNumber="121"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// The legality of the wrapped instruction. This is informed by InstrType,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00122" /><CodeLine lineNumber="122"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// and is used when checking when two instructions are considered similar.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00123" /><CodeLine lineNumber="123"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// If either instruction is not legal, the instructions are automatically not</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00124" /><CodeLine lineNumber="124"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// considered similar.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00125" /><CodeLine lineNumber="125" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/irsimilarity/irinstructiondata/#ad05fd093f3eb994c056a4d353684aaf8"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/irsimilarity/irinstructiondata/#ad05fd093f3eb994c056a4d353684aaf8">Legal</a> = </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">false</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00126" /><CodeLine lineNumber="126"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00127" /><CodeLine lineNumber="127"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// This is only relevant if we are wrapping a CmpInst where we needed to</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00128" /><CodeLine lineNumber="128"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// change the predicate of a compare instruction from a greater than form</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00129" /><CodeLine lineNumber="129"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// to a less than form.  It is std::nullopt otherwise.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00130" /><CodeLine lineNumber="130" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/irsimilarity/irinstructiondata/#aed3027a8796d2aa6a899077856e14da4"><Highlight kind="normal">  std::optional&lt;CmpInst::Predicate&gt; <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/irsimilarity/irinstructiondata/#aed3027a8796d2aa6a899077856e14da4">RevisedPredicate</a>;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00131" /><CodeLine lineNumber="131"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00132" /><CodeLine lineNumber="132"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// This is only relevant if we are wrapping a CallInst. If we are requiring</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00133" /><CodeLine lineNumber="133"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// that the function calls have matching names as well as types, and the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00134" /><CodeLine lineNumber="134"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// call is not an indirect call, this will hold the name of the function.  If</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00135" /><CodeLine lineNumber="135"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// it is an indirect string, it will be the empty string.  However, if this</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00136" /><CodeLine lineNumber="136"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// requirement is not in place it will be the empty string regardless of the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00137" /><CodeLine lineNumber="137"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// function call type.  The value held here is used to create the hash of the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00138" /><CodeLine lineNumber="138"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// instruction, and check to make sure two instructions are close to one</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00139" /><CodeLine lineNumber="139"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// another.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00140" /><CodeLine lineNumber="140" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/irsimilarity/irinstructiondata/#a292aaa1e14576c8e38a2aad65d44f833"><Highlight kind="normal">  std::optional&lt;std::string&gt; <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/irsimilarity/irinstructiondata/#a292aaa1e14576c8e38a2aad65d44f833">CalleeName</a>;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00141" /><CodeLine lineNumber="141"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00142" /><CodeLine lineNumber="142"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// This structure holds the distances of how far &quot;ahead of&quot; or &quot;behind&quot; the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00143" /><CodeLine lineNumber="143"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// target blocks of a branch, or the incoming blocks of a phi nodes are.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00144" /><CodeLine lineNumber="144"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// If the value is negative, it means that the block was registered before</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00145" /><CodeLine lineNumber="145"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// the block of this instruction in terms of blocks in the function.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00146" /><CodeLine lineNumber="146"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Code Example:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00147" /><CodeLine lineNumber="147"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\code</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00148" /><CodeLine lineNumber="148"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// block&#95;1:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00149" /><CodeLine lineNumber="149"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///   br i1 %0, label %block&#95;2, label %block&#95;3</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00150" /><CodeLine lineNumber="150"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// block&#95;2:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00151" /><CodeLine lineNumber="151"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///   br i1 %1, label %block&#95;1, label %block&#95;2</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00152" /><CodeLine lineNumber="152"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// block&#95;3:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00153" /><CodeLine lineNumber="153"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///   br i1 %2, label %block&#95;2, label %block&#95;1</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00154" /><CodeLine lineNumber="154"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// ; Replacing the labels with relative values, this becomes:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00155" /><CodeLine lineNumber="155"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// block&#95;1:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00156" /><CodeLine lineNumber="156"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///   br i1 %0, distance 1, distance 2</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00157" /><CodeLine lineNumber="157"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// block&#95;2:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00158" /><CodeLine lineNumber="158"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///   br i1 %1, distance -1, distance 0</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00159" /><CodeLine lineNumber="159"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// block&#95;3:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00160" /><CodeLine lineNumber="160"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///   br i1 %2, distance -1, distance -2</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00161" /><CodeLine lineNumber="161"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\endcode</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00162" /><CodeLine lineNumber="162"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Taking block&#95;2 as our example, block&#95;1 is &quot;behind&quot; block&#95;2, and block&#95;2 is</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00163" /><CodeLine lineNumber="163"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// &quot;ahead&quot; of block&#95;2.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00164" /><CodeLine lineNumber="164" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/irsimilarity/irinstructiondata/#a2606c92d4c122037d9065123c3db3093"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvector">SmallVector&lt;int, 4&gt;</a> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/irsimilarity/irinstructiondata/#a2606c92d4c122037d9065123c3db3093">RelativeBlockLocations</a>;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00165" /><CodeLine lineNumber="165"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00166" /><CodeLine lineNumber="166"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Gather the information that is difficult to gather for an Instruction, or</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00167" /><CodeLine lineNumber="167"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// is changed. i.e. the operands of an Instruction and the Types of those</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00168" /><CodeLine lineNumber="168"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// operands. This extra information allows for similarity matching to make</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00169" /><CodeLine lineNumber="169"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// assertions that allow for more flexibility when checking for whether an</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00170" /><CodeLine lineNumber="170"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Instruction performs the same operation.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00186" /><CodeLine lineNumber="186"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// A function that swaps the predicates to their less than form if they are</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00187" /><CodeLine lineNumber="187"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// in a greater than form. Otherwise, the predicate is unchanged.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00188" /><CodeLine lineNumber="188"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00193" /><CodeLine lineNumber="193"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// For an IRInstructionData containing a branch, finds the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00194" /><CodeLine lineNumber="194"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// relative distances from the source basic block to the target by taking</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00195" /><CodeLine lineNumber="195"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// the difference of the number assigned to the current basic block and the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00196" /><CodeLine lineNumber="196"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// target basic block of the branch.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00197" /><CodeLine lineNumber="197"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00199" /><CodeLine lineNumber="199"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// in the module.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00200" /><CodeLine lineNumber="200"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00203" /><CodeLine lineNumber="203"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// For an IRInstructionData containing a CallInst, set the function name</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00204" /><CodeLine lineNumber="204"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// appropriately.  This will be an empty string if it is an indirect call,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00205" /><CodeLine lineNumber="205"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// or we are not matching by name of the called function.  It will be the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00206" /><CodeLine lineNumber="206"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// name of the function if \\p MatchByName is true and it is not an indirect</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00207" /><CodeLine lineNumber="207"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// call.  We may decide not to match by name in order to expand the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00208" /><CodeLine lineNumber="208"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// size of the regions we can match.  If a function name has the same type</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00209" /><CodeLine lineNumber="209"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// signature, but the different name, the region of code is still almost the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00210" /><CodeLine lineNumber="210"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// same.  Since function names can be treated as constants, the name itself</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00211" /><CodeLine lineNumber="211"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// could be extrapolated away.  However, matching by name provides a</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00212" /><CodeLine lineNumber="212"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// specificity and more &quot;identical&quot; code than not matching by name.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00213" /><CodeLine lineNumber="213"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00214" /><CodeLine lineNumber="214"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\param MatchByName - A flag to mark whether we are using the called</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00215" /><CodeLine lineNumber="215"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// function name as a differentiating parameter.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00216" /><CodeLine lineNumber="216"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/irsimilarity/irinstructiondata/#ae0683ad49b9a0ccca8bd1c97987a8cf9">setCalleeName</a>(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> MatchByName = </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">true</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">);</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00218" /><CodeLine lineNumber="218"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// For an IRInstructionData containing a PHINode, finds the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00219" /><CodeLine lineNumber="219"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// relative distances from the incoming basic block to the current block by</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00220" /><CodeLine lineNumber="220"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// taking the difference of the number assigned to the current basic block</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00221" /><CodeLine lineNumber="221"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// and the incoming basic block of the branch.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00222" /><CodeLine lineNumber="222"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00223" /><CodeLine lineNumber="223"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\param BasicBlockToInteger - The mapping of basic blocks to their location</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00224" /><CodeLine lineNumber="224"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// in the module.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00225" /><CodeLine lineNumber="225"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00228" /><CodeLine lineNumber="228"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Get the BasicBlock based operands for PHINodes and BranchInsts.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00229" /><CodeLine lineNumber="229"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00230" /><CodeLine lineNumber="230"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\returns A list of relevant BasicBlocks.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00231" /><CodeLine lineNumber="231"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/arrayref">ArrayRef&lt;Value &#42;&gt;</a> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/irsimilarity/irinstructiondata/#a39ea8bd6480d74c1dab6eb54eae61d27">getBlockOperVals</a>();</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00232" /><CodeLine lineNumber="232"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00233" /><CodeLine lineNumber="233"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Hashes \\p Value based on its opcode, types, and operand types.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00234" /><CodeLine lineNumber="234"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Two IRInstructionData instances produce the same hash when they perform</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00235" /><CodeLine lineNumber="235"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// the same operation.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00236" /><CodeLine lineNumber="236"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00237" /><CodeLine lineNumber="237"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// As a simple example, consider the following instructions.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00238" /><CodeLine lineNumber="238"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00239" /><CodeLine lineNumber="239"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\code</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00240" /><CodeLine lineNumber="240"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// %add1 = add i32 %x1, %y1</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00241" /><CodeLine lineNumber="241"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// %add2 = add i32 %x2, %y2</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00242" /><CodeLine lineNumber="242"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00243" /><CodeLine lineNumber="243"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// %sub = sub i32 %x1, %y1</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00244" /><CodeLine lineNumber="244"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00245" /><CodeLine lineNumber="245"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// %add&#95;i64 = add i64 %x2, %y2</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00246" /><CodeLine lineNumber="246"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\endcode</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00247" /><CodeLine lineNumber="247"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00248" /><CodeLine lineNumber="248"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Because the first two adds operate the same types, and are performing the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00249" /><CodeLine lineNumber="249"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// same action, they will be hashed to the same value.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00250" /><CodeLine lineNumber="250"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00251" /><CodeLine lineNumber="251"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// However, the subtraction instruction is not the same as an addition, and</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00252" /><CodeLine lineNumber="252"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// will be hashed to a different value.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00253" /><CodeLine lineNumber="253"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00254" /><CodeLine lineNumber="254"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Finally, the last add has a different type compared to the first two add</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00255" /><CodeLine lineNumber="255"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// instructions, so it will also be hashed to a different value that any of</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00256" /><CodeLine lineNumber="256"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// the previous instructions.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00257" /><CodeLine lineNumber="257"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00258" /><CodeLine lineNumber="258"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\param &#91;in&#93; ID - The IRInstructionData instance to be hashed.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00259" /><CodeLine lineNumber="259"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\returns A hash&#95;value of the IRInstructionData.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00260" /><CodeLine lineNumber="260" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/irsimilarity/irinstructiondata/#ac3fdb189d1625b937b2aedcf1de64f09"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">friend</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/hash-code">hash&#95;code</a> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/irsimilarity/irinstructiondata/#ac3fdb189d1625b937b2aedcf1de64f09">hash&#95;value</a>(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/irsimilarity/irinstructiondata/#a31d26022f657b77aa802a9190611e87b">IRInstructionData</a> &amp;<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#abdf8cf606905c10634e831390981b0ed">ID</a>) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00304" /><CodeLine lineNumber="304"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00305" /><CodeLine lineNumber="305"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Compare one IRInstructionData class to another IRInstructionData class for</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00306" /><CodeLine lineNumber="306"><Highlight kind="comment">/// whether they are performing a the same operation, and can mapped to the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00307" /><CodeLine lineNumber="307"><Highlight kind="comment">/// same value. For regular instructions if the hash value is the same, then</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00308" /><CodeLine lineNumber="308"><Highlight kind="comment">/// they will also be close.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00309" /><CodeLine lineNumber="309"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00310" /><CodeLine lineNumber="310"><Highlight kind="comment">/// \\param A - The first IRInstructionData class to compare</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00311" /><CodeLine lineNumber="311"><Highlight kind="comment">/// \\param B - The second IRInstructionData class to compare</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00312" /><CodeLine lineNumber="312"><Highlight kind="comment">/// \\returns true if \\p A and \\p B are similar enough to be mapped to the same</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00313" /><CodeLine lineNumber="313"><Highlight kind="comment">/// value.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00314" /><CodeLine lineNumber="314"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/irsimilarity/#ad7518d710d81c7c4c04cc6a61e7d65bc">isClose</a>(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/irsimilarity/irinstructiondata">IRInstructionData</a> &amp;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/builtingcs-cpp/#a2e38c85003a042421cde1647632d0b72">A</a>, </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/irsimilarity/irinstructiondata">IRInstructionData</a> &amp;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/builtingcs-cpp/#ae76959fe811ba090de4cba69ac00f1da">B</a>);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00315" /><CodeLine lineNumber="315"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00316" /><CodeLine lineNumber="316" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/irsimilarity/irinstructiondatatraits"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">struct </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/irsimilarity/irinstructiondatatraits">IRInstructionDataTraits</a> : <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/densemapinfo">DenseMapInfo</a>&lt;IRInstructionData &#42;&gt; &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00338" /><CodeLine lineNumber="338"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00339" /><CodeLine lineNumber="339"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Helper struct for converting the Instructions in a Module into a vector of</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00340" /><CodeLine lineNumber="340"><Highlight kind="comment">/// unsigned integers. This vector of unsigned integers can be thought of as a</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00341" /><CodeLine lineNumber="341"><Highlight kind="comment">/// &quot;numeric string&quot;. This numeric string can then be queried by, for example,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00342" /><CodeLine lineNumber="342"><Highlight kind="comment">/// data structures that find repeated substrings.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00343" /><CodeLine lineNumber="343"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00344" /><CodeLine lineNumber="344"><Highlight kind="comment">/// This hashing is done per BasicBlock in the module. To hash Instructions</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00345" /><CodeLine lineNumber="345"><Highlight kind="comment">/// based off of their operations, each Instruction is wrapped in an</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00346" /><CodeLine lineNumber="346"><Highlight kind="comment">/// IRInstructionData struct. The unsigned integer for an IRInstructionData</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00347" /><CodeLine lineNumber="347"><Highlight kind="comment">/// depends on:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00348" /><CodeLine lineNumber="348"><Highlight kind="comment">/// - The hash provided by the IRInstructionData.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00349" /><CodeLine lineNumber="349"><Highlight kind="comment">/// - Which member of InstrType the IRInstructionData is classified as.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00350" /><CodeLine lineNumber="350"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// See InstrType for more details on the possible classifications, and how they</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00351" /><CodeLine lineNumber="351"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// manifest in the numeric string.</Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00352" /><CodeLine lineNumber="352"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00353" /><CodeLine lineNumber="353"><Highlight kind="comment">/// The numeric string for an individual BasicBlock is terminated by an unique</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00354" /><CodeLine lineNumber="354"><Highlight kind="comment">/// unsigned integer. This prevents data structures which rely on repetition</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00355" /><CodeLine lineNumber="355"><Highlight kind="comment">/// from matching across BasicBlocks. (For example, the SuffixTree.)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00356" /><CodeLine lineNumber="356"><Highlight kind="comment">/// As a concrete example, if we have the following two BasicBlocks:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00357" /><CodeLine lineNumber="357"><Highlight kind="comment">/// \\code</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00358" /><CodeLine lineNumber="358"><Highlight kind="comment">/// bb0:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00359" /><CodeLine lineNumber="359"><Highlight kind="comment">/// %add1 = add i32 %a, %b</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00360" /><CodeLine lineNumber="360"><Highlight kind="comment">/// %add2 = add i32 %c, %d</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00361" /><CodeLine lineNumber="361"><Highlight kind="comment">/// %add3 = add i64 %e, %f</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00362" /><CodeLine lineNumber="362"><Highlight kind="comment">/// bb1:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00363" /><CodeLine lineNumber="363"><Highlight kind="comment">/// %sub = sub i32 %c, %d</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00364" /><CodeLine lineNumber="364"><Highlight kind="comment">/// \\endcode</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00365" /><CodeLine lineNumber="365"><Highlight kind="comment">/// We may hash the Instructions like this (via IRInstructionData):</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00366" /><CodeLine lineNumber="366"><Highlight kind="comment">/// \\code</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00367" /><CodeLine lineNumber="367"><Highlight kind="comment">/// bb0:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00368" /><CodeLine lineNumber="368"><Highlight kind="comment">/// %add1 = add i32 %a, %b ; Hash: 1</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00369" /><CodeLine lineNumber="369"><Highlight kind="comment">/// %add2 = add i32 %c, %d; Hash: 1</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00370" /><CodeLine lineNumber="370"><Highlight kind="comment">/// %add3 = add i64 %e, %f; Hash: 2</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00371" /><CodeLine lineNumber="371"><Highlight kind="comment">/// bb1:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00372" /><CodeLine lineNumber="372"><Highlight kind="comment">/// %sub = sub i32 %c, %d; Hash: 3</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00373" /><CodeLine lineNumber="373"><Highlight kind="comment">/// %add4 = add i32 %c, %d ; Hash: 1</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00374" /><CodeLine lineNumber="374"><Highlight kind="comment">/// \\endcode</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00375" /><CodeLine lineNumber="375"><Highlight kind="comment">/// And produce a &quot;numeric string representation&quot; like so:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00376" /><CodeLine lineNumber="376"><Highlight kind="comment">/// 1, 1, 2, unique&#95;integer&#95;1, 3, 1, unique&#95;integer&#95;2</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00377" /><CodeLine lineNumber="377"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00378" /><CodeLine lineNumber="378"><Highlight kind="comment">/// TODO: This is very similar to the MachineOutliner, and should be</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00379" /><CodeLine lineNumber="379"><Highlight kind="comment">/// consolidated into the same interface.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00380" /><CodeLine lineNumber="380" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/irsimilarity/irinstructionmapper"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">struct </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/irsimilarity/irinstructionmapper/#ab074cefd064d3c9f84f7207dbee71724">IRInstructionMapper</a> &#123;</Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00381" /><CodeLine lineNumber="381"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// The starting illegal instruction number to map to.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00382" /><CodeLine lineNumber="382"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00383" /><CodeLine lineNumber="383"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Set to -3 for compatibility with DenseMapInfo&lt;unsigned&gt;.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00384" /><CodeLine lineNumber="384" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/irsimilarity/irinstructionmapper/#a60e5af3b7e239b6fdad88efbe1e861bd"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/irsimilarity/irinstructionmapper/#a60e5af3b7e239b6fdad88efbe1e861bd">IllegalInstrNumber</a> = </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">static&#95;cast&lt;</Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">&gt;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">(-3);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00385" /><CodeLine lineNumber="385"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00386" /><CodeLine lineNumber="386"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// The next available integer to assign to a legal Instruction to.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00388" /><CodeLine lineNumber="388"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00394" /><CodeLine lineNumber="394"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// in the module.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00459" /><CodeLine lineNumber="459"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00460" /><CodeLine lineNumber="460"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Assigns values to all the basic blocks in Module \\p M.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00461" /><CodeLine lineNumber="461"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\param M - The module containing the basic blocks to assign numbers to.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00462" /><CodeLine lineNumber="462" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/irsimilarity/irinstructionmapper/#aac04bc0ac4b1620a9c9aa65c761b3344"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/irsimilarity/irinstructionmapper/#aac04bc0ac4b1620a9c9aa65c761b3344">initializeForBBs</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/module">Module</a> &amp;M) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00463" /><CodeLine lineNumber="463"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> BBNumber = 0;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00464" /><CodeLine lineNumber="464"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">for</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/function">Function</a> &amp;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#a96d73bbd7af15cb1fc38c3f4a3bd82e9">F</a> : M)</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00471" /><CodeLine lineNumber="471"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00549" /><CodeLine lineNumber="549"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// These are disabled due to complications in the CodeExtractor when</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00550" /><CodeLine lineNumber="550"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// outlining these instructions.  For instance, It is unclear what we</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00551" /><CodeLine lineNumber="551"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// should do when moving only the start or end lifetime instruction into</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00552" /><CodeLine lineNumber="552"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// an outlined function. Also, assume-like intrinsics could be removed</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00553" /><CodeLine lineNumber="553"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// from the region, removing arguments, causing discrepencies in the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00607" /><CodeLine lineNumber="607"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Maps an Instruction to a member of InstrType.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00608" /><CodeLine lineNumber="608" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/irsimilarity/irinstructionmapper/#a7a0011906a29aacd3db06d94b41193e2"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/irsimilarity/irinstructionmapper/instructionclassification">InstructionClassification</a> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/irsimilarity/irinstructionmapper/#a7a0011906a29aacd3db06d94b41193e2">InstClassifier</a>;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00609" /><CodeLine lineNumber="609"><Highlight kind="normal">&#125;;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00610" /><CodeLine lineNumber="610"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00611" /><CodeLine lineNumber="611"><Highlight kind="comment">/// This is a class that wraps a range of IRInstructionData from one point to</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00612" /><CodeLine lineNumber="612"><Highlight kind="comment">/// another in the vector of IRInstructionData, which is a region of the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00613" /><CodeLine lineNumber="613"><Highlight kind="comment">/// program.  It is also responsible for defining the structure within this</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00614" /><CodeLine lineNumber="614"><Highlight kind="comment">/// region of instructions.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00615" /><CodeLine lineNumber="615"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00616" /><CodeLine lineNumber="616"><Highlight kind="comment">/// The structure of a region is defined through a value numbering system</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00617" /><CodeLine lineNumber="617"><Highlight kind="comment">/// assigned to each unique value in a region at the creation of the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00618" /><CodeLine lineNumber="618"><Highlight kind="comment">/// IRSimilarityCandidate.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00619" /><CodeLine lineNumber="619"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00620" /><CodeLine lineNumber="620"><Highlight kind="comment">/// For example, for each Instruction we add a mapping for each new</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00621" /><CodeLine lineNumber="621"><Highlight kind="comment">/// value seen in that Instruction.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00622" /><CodeLine lineNumber="622"><Highlight kind="comment">/// IR:                    Mapping Added:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00623" /><CodeLine lineNumber="623"><Highlight kind="comment">/// %add1 = add i32 %a, c1    %add1 -&gt; 3, %a -&gt; 1, c1 -&gt; 2</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00624" /><CodeLine lineNumber="624"><Highlight kind="comment">/// %add2 = add i32 %a, %1    %add2 -&gt; 4</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00625" /><CodeLine lineNumber="625"><Highlight kind="comment">/// %add3 = add i32 c2, c1    %add3 -&gt; 6, c2 -&gt; 5</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00626" /><CodeLine lineNumber="626"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00627" /><CodeLine lineNumber="627"><Highlight kind="comment">/// We can compare IRSimilarityCandidates against one another.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00628" /><CodeLine lineNumber="628"><Highlight kind="comment">/// The \\ref isSimilar function compares each IRInstructionData against one</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00629" /><CodeLine lineNumber="629"><Highlight kind="comment">/// another and if we have the same sequences of IRInstructionData that would</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00630" /><CodeLine lineNumber="630"><Highlight kind="comment">/// create the same hash, we have similar IRSimilarityCandidates.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00631" /><CodeLine lineNumber="631"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00632" /><CodeLine lineNumber="632"><Highlight kind="comment">/// We can also compare the structure of IRSimilarityCandidates. If we can</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00633" /><CodeLine lineNumber="633"><Highlight kind="comment">/// create a mapping of registers in the region contained by one</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00634" /><CodeLine lineNumber="634"><Highlight kind="comment">/// IRSimilarityCandidate to the region contained by different</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00635" /><CodeLine lineNumber="635"><Highlight kind="comment">/// IRSimilarityCandidate, they can be considered structurally similar.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00636" /><CodeLine lineNumber="636"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00637" /><CodeLine lineNumber="637"><Highlight kind="comment">/// IRSimilarityCandidate1:   IRSimilarityCandidate2:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00638" /><CodeLine lineNumber="638"><Highlight kind="comment">/// %add1 = add i32 %a, %b    %add1 = add i32 %d, %e</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00639" /><CodeLine lineNumber="639"><Highlight kind="comment">/// %add2 = add i32 %a, %c    %add2 = add i32 %d, %f</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00640" /><CodeLine lineNumber="640"><Highlight kind="comment">/// %add3 = add i32 c1, c2    %add3 = add i32 c3, c4</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00641" /><CodeLine lineNumber="641"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00642" /><CodeLine lineNumber="642"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Can have the following mapping from candidate to candidate of:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00643" /><CodeLine lineNumber="643"><Highlight kind="comment">/// %a -&gt; %d, %b -&gt; %e, %c -&gt; %f, c1 -&gt; c3, c2 -&gt; c4</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00644" /><CodeLine lineNumber="644"><Highlight kind="comment">/// and can be considered similar.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00645" /><CodeLine lineNumber="645"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00646" /><CodeLine lineNumber="646"><Highlight kind="comment">/// IRSimilarityCandidate1:   IRSimilarityCandidate2:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00647" /><CodeLine lineNumber="647"><Highlight kind="comment">/// %add1 = add i32 %a, %b    %add1 = add i32 %d, c4</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00648" /><CodeLine lineNumber="648"><Highlight kind="comment">/// %add2 = add i32 %a, %c    %add2 = add i32 %d, %f</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00649" /><CodeLine lineNumber="649"><Highlight kind="comment">/// %add3 = add i32 c1, c2    %add3 = add i32 c3, c4</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00650" /><CodeLine lineNumber="650"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00651" /><CodeLine lineNumber="651"><Highlight kind="comment">/// We cannot create the same mapping since the use of c4 is not used in the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00652" /><CodeLine lineNumber="652"><Highlight kind="comment">/// same way as %b or c2.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00653" /><CodeLine lineNumber="653" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/irsimilarity/irsimilaritycandidate"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">class </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/irsimilarity/irsimilaritycandidate/#ae35aff2dc6fcdec60f53cdcfabea59f7">IRSimilarityCandidate</a> &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00654" /><CodeLine lineNumber="654"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">private</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">:</Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00655" /><CodeLine lineNumber="655"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// The start index of this IRSimilarityCandidate in the instruction list.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00656" /><CodeLine lineNumber="656"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> StartIdx = 0;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00657" /><CodeLine lineNumber="657"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00658" /><CodeLine lineNumber="658"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// The number of instructions in this IRSimilarityCandidate.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00659" /><CodeLine lineNumber="659"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> Len = 0;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00660" /><CodeLine lineNumber="660"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00661" /><CodeLine lineNumber="661"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// The first instruction in this IRSimilarityCandidate.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00662" /><CodeLine lineNumber="662"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/irsimilarity/irinstructiondata">IRInstructionData</a> &#42;FirstInst = </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">nullptr</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00663" /><CodeLine lineNumber="663"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00664" /><CodeLine lineNumber="664"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// The last instruction in this IRSimilarityCandidate.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00665" /><CodeLine lineNumber="665"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/irsimilarity/irinstructiondata">IRInstructionData</a> &#42;LastInst = </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">nullptr</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00785" /><CodeLine lineNumber="785"><Highlight kind="normal">      <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/densemap">DenseMap</a>&lt;</Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/denseset">DenseSet&lt;unsigned&gt;</a>&gt; &amp;ValueNumberMappingA,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00786" /><CodeLine lineNumber="786"><Highlight kind="normal">      <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/densemap">DenseMap</a>&lt;</Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/denseset">DenseSet&lt;unsigned&gt;</a>&gt; &amp;ValueNumberMappingB);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00787" /><CodeLine lineNumber="787"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00788" /><CodeLine lineNumber="788"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Compare the relative locations in \\p A and \\p B and check that the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00789" /><CodeLine lineNumber="789"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// distances match if both locations are contained in the region, and that</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00790" /><CodeLine lineNumber="790"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// the branches both point outside the region if they do not.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00791" /><CodeLine lineNumber="791"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Example Region:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00792" /><CodeLine lineNumber="792"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\code</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00793" /><CodeLine lineNumber="793"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// entry:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00794" /><CodeLine lineNumber="794"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///   br i1 %0, label %block&#95;1, label %block&#95;3</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00795" /><CodeLine lineNumber="795"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// block&#95;0:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00796" /><CodeLine lineNumber="796"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///   br i1 %0, label %block&#95;1, label %block&#95;2</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00797" /><CodeLine lineNumber="797"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// block&#95;1:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00798" /><CodeLine lineNumber="798"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///   br i1 %0, label %block&#95;2, label %block&#95;3</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00799" /><CodeLine lineNumber="799"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// block&#95;2:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00800" /><CodeLine lineNumber="800"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///   br i1 %1, label %block&#95;1, label %block&#95;4</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00801" /><CodeLine lineNumber="801"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// block&#95;3:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00802" /><CodeLine lineNumber="802"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///   br i1 %2, label %block&#95;2, label %block&#95;5</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00803" /><CodeLine lineNumber="803"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\endcode</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00804" /><CodeLine lineNumber="804"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// If we compare the branches in block&#95;0 and block&#95;1 the relative values are</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00805" /><CodeLine lineNumber="805"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// 1 and 2 for both, so we consider this a match.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00806" /><CodeLine lineNumber="806"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00807" /><CodeLine lineNumber="807"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// If we compare the branches in entry and block&#95;0 the relative values are</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00808" /><CodeLine lineNumber="808"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// 2 and 3, and 1 and 2 respectively.  Since these are not the same we do not</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00809" /><CodeLine lineNumber="809"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// consider them a match.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00810" /><CodeLine lineNumber="810"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00811" /><CodeLine lineNumber="811"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// If we compare the branches in block&#95;1 and block&#95;2 the relative values are</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00812" /><CodeLine lineNumber="812"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// 1 and 2, and -1 and None respectively.  As a result we do not consider</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00813" /><CodeLine lineNumber="813"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// these to be the same</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00814" /><CodeLine lineNumber="814"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00815" /><CodeLine lineNumber="815"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// If we compare the branches in block&#95;2 and block&#95;3 the relative values are</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00816" /><CodeLine lineNumber="816"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// -1 and None for both.  We do consider these to be a match.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00817" /><CodeLine lineNumber="817"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00818" /><CodeLine lineNumber="818"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\param A - The first IRInstructionCandidate, relative location value,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00819" /><CodeLine lineNumber="819"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// and incoming block.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00820" /><CodeLine lineNumber="820"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\param B - The second IRInstructionCandidate, relative location value,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00821" /><CodeLine lineNumber="821"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// and incoming block.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00822" /><CodeLine lineNumber="822"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\returns true if the relative locations match.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00823" /><CodeLine lineNumber="823"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">static</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/irsimilarity/irsimilaritycandidate/#aa8a8f00e0169503c48f26bffcf4d6646">checkRelativeLocations</a>(<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/irsimilarity/irsimilaritycandidate/relativelocmapping">RelativeLocMapping</a> <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/builtingcs-cpp/#a2e38c85003a042421cde1647632d0b72">A</a>,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00824" /><CodeLine lineNumber="824"><Highlight kind="normal">                                     <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/irsimilarity/irsimilaritycandidate/relativelocmapping">RelativeLocMapping</a> <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/builtingcs-cpp/#ae76959fe811ba090de4cba69ac00f1da">B</a>);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00825" /><CodeLine lineNumber="825"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00826" /><CodeLine lineNumber="826"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Create a mapping from the value numbering to a different separate set of</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00827" /><CodeLine lineNumber="827"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// numbers. This will serve as a guide for relating one candidate to another.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00828" /><CodeLine lineNumber="828"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// The canonical number gives use the ability identify which global value</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00829" /><CodeLine lineNumber="829"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// number in one candidate relates to the global value number in the other.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00830" /><CodeLine lineNumber="830"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00831" /><CodeLine lineNumber="831"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\param &#91;in, out&#93; CurrCand - The IRSimilarityCandidate to create a</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00832" /><CodeLine lineNumber="832"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// canonical numbering for.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00833" /><CodeLine lineNumber="833"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">static</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/irsimilarity/irsimilaritycandidate/#ab887db0898db0bfae23199acc51e4f48">createCanonicalMappingFor</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/irsimilarity/irsimilaritycandidate/#ae35aff2dc6fcdec60f53cdcfabea59f7">IRSimilarityCandidate</a> &amp;CurrCand);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00834" /><CodeLine lineNumber="834"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00835" /><CodeLine lineNumber="835"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Create a mapping for the value numbering of the calling</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00914" /><CodeLine lineNumber="914"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00915" /><CodeLine lineNumber="915"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Compare the start and end indices of the two IRSimilarityCandidates for</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00916" /><CodeLine lineNumber="916"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// whether they overlap. If the start instruction of one</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00917" /><CodeLine lineNumber="917"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// IRSimilarityCandidate is less than the end instruction of the other, and</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00918" /><CodeLine lineNumber="918"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// the start instruction of one is greater than the start instruction of the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00919" /><CodeLine lineNumber="919"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// other, they overlap.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00920" /><CodeLine lineNumber="920"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00921" /><CodeLine lineNumber="921"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\returns true if the IRSimilarityCandidates do not have overlapping</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00922" /><CodeLine lineNumber="922"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// instructions.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00923" /><CodeLine lineNumber="923"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">static</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/irsimilarity/irsimilaritycandidate/#ad02bc9bd1feca133eb84b3618e93fb37">overlap</a>(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/irsimilarity/irsimilaritycandidate">IRSimilarityCandidate</a> &amp;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/builtingcs-cpp/#a2e38c85003a042421cde1647632d0b72">A</a>,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00924" /><CodeLine lineNumber="924"><Highlight kind="normal">                      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/irsimilarity/irsimilaritycandidate">IRSimilarityCandidate</a> &amp;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/builtingcs-cpp/#ae76959fe811ba090de4cba69ac00f1da">B</a>);</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01020" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1020"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01021" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1021"><Highlight kind="comment">/// This class puts all the pieces of the IRInstructionData,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01022" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1022"><Highlight kind="comment">/// IRInstructionMapper, IRSimilarityCandidate together.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01023" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1023"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01024" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1024"><Highlight kind="comment">/// It first feeds the Module or vector of Modules into the IRInstructionMapper,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01025" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1025"><Highlight kind="comment">/// and puts all the mapped instructions into a single long list of</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01026" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1026"><Highlight kind="comment">/// IRInstructionData.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01027" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1027"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01028" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1028"><Highlight kind="comment">/// The list of unsigned integers is given to the Suffix Tree or similar data</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01029" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1029"><Highlight kind="comment">/// structure to find repeated subsequences.  We construct an</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01030" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1030"><Highlight kind="comment">/// IRSimilarityCandidate for each instance of the subsequence.  We compare them</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01031" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1031"><Highlight kind="comment">/// against one another since  These repeated subsequences can have different</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01032" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1032"><Highlight kind="comment">/// structure.  For each different kind of structure found, we create a</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01033" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1033"><Highlight kind="comment">/// similarity group.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01034" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1034"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01035" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1035"><Highlight kind="comment">/// If we had four IRSimilarityCandidates A, B, C, and D where A, B and D are</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01036" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1036"><Highlight kind="comment">/// structurally similar to one another, while C is different we would have two</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01037" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1037"><Highlight kind="comment">/// SimilarityGroups:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01038" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1038"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01039" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1039"><Highlight kind="comment">/// SimilarityGroup 1:  SimilarityGroup 2</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01040" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1040"><Highlight kind="comment">/// A, B, D             C</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01041" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1041"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01042" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1042"><Highlight kind="comment">/// A list of the different similarity groups is then returned after</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01043" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1043"><Highlight kind="comment">/// analyzing the module.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01044" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1044" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/irsimilarity/irsimilarityidentifier"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">class </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/irsimilarity/irsimilarityidentifier/#a3c4131532750c5351e0baa4adfd59011">IRSimilarityIdentifier</a> &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01045" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1045"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">public</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">:</Highlight></CodeLine>
